What are the objectives of the Stri-Sewa Scheme?

The objectives of the Scheme would be manifold, including: To establish a mechanism for redressal of grievances relating to availing of essential services and government schemes for women and to enable women to access them better. To effectively use Information Communication Technology (hereinafter “ICT”) infrastructure in providing different services. To eliminate red-tapism and delays in approaching different Departments/Authorities. To make legal aid easily accessible to women of all strata and geographical regions. To inter-link the operation of Legal Aid Cells in Law Colleges/Universities at a national level to enable quicker access to legal aid. To empower women through legal literacy and thereby facilitate access to justice. To nurture flexible responses on inputs from women in distress on the obstacles faced by them and on specific issues for improvement.
